TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit MsmqIntegrationBindingElement extends System.ServiceModel.Channels.MsmqBindingElementBase

summary.para: This binding element can be used to enable indigo1 applications to send messages to and receive messages from existing MSMQ applications that use either COM, MSMQ native APIs, or the APIs in . Use this class to send and receive messages from MSMQ-based messaging applications.

MemberSignature.Value: public MsmqIntegrationBindingElement ();
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory<TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context);

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelFactory`1<!!TChannel> BuildChannelFactory<TChannel>(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) cil managed

remarks.para: This method builds a channel factory that enables the developer to create a client channel to communicate with a service. The channel factory is not a channel, but rather a factory that can create a channel. You create a channel by calling IChannelFactory<TChannel>.CreateChannel.

summary.para: Builds a channel factory using the context provided.

returns.para: An MSMQ integration channel factory that can be used to create channels to send messages to existing MSMQ applications.

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel factory.

MemberSignature.Value: public override System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener<TChannel> BuildChannelListener<TChannel> (System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) where TChannel : class, System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel;

.method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannelListener`1<!!TChannel> BuildChannelListener<class (class System.ServiceModel.Channels.IChannel) TChannel>(class System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingContext context) cil managed

remarks.para: Channel listeners are created on the service and are used to receive messages sent by a client channel. The service must call IChannelListener.Open and then IChannelListener.AcceptChannel to get a reference to the actual channel. Then IChannel.Open must be called to open the channel. At this point, the channel can be used to retrieve messages.

summary.para: Builds a channel listener using the context provided.

returns.para: An MSMQ integration channel listener that can be used to create channels to receive messages from existing MSMQ applications.

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel listener.

summary.para: Returns a value that indicates whether you can build a channel factory with the context provided.

Docs.param: The with which to build the channel factory.

remarks.para: This method provides the functionality to retrieve capabilities and protection requirements from the element.

summary.para: Gets a property of the requested type from the specified BindingContext.

MemberSignature.Value: public override string Scheme { get; }
.property instance string Scheme

remarks.para: This property returns the string "msmq.formatname" to indicate the addressing scheme used by the MSMQ integration channel. For more information about queue addressing, see Service Endpoints and Queue Addressing.

summary.para: Gets a that contains the scheme used by the binding element.

MemberSignature.Value: public System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat SerializationFormat { get; set; }
.property instance valuetype System.ServiceModel.MsmqIntegration.MsmqMessageSerializationFormat SerializationFormat

remarks.para: This property can have one of the following values:

item.para: ActiveX - The ActiveX serializer is used to serialize objects.
Binary - The is used to serialize objects.
ByteArray - The object is serialized to an array of bytes.
Stream - The object is serialized to a stream.
Xml - The is used to serialize objects.

summary.para: Gets or sets the to be used when serializing MSMQ messages.

MemberSignature.Value: public Type[] TargetSerializationTypes { get; set; }
.property instance class System.Type[] TargetSerializationTypes

remarks.para: The body of an MSMQ message is not typed. The property enables you to specify the types to which messages are deserialized when they are sent from an MSMQ application to a indigo1 receiving application. This property is used only if is set to Xml.

summary.para: Gets or sets an array of objects that contain the types to which messages should be deserialized.
